result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy E Lukasavitz

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packet
Bail refund check packet
5/3/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Defendant plead NO CONTEST. Court found the defendant guilty. 

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 including all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 6/27/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Received and Filed, Final Review Report and letter on behalf of defendant. Defendant completed DPA agreement. Court VACATES plea. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Court amended count 1 to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.01, a Civil Forfeiture.

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Mid-Point Review received and filed. Court ordered case back to Final Review Hearing in branch 24.  Review hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The court is hearing this case for Judge Dallet.  
As to count 1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of seven months.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
Case adjourned to Branch 40 for a review hearing.
  Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 09-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court there is a possible deferred prosecution resolution to this case.  Court orders case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-21-2015
Court added bail conditions of ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40 
Defense counsel requested modification of the no contact order to a no violent contact order for reasons placed on the record. Victim in court, joined request to modify no contact order to no violent contact order. State took no position on modification. Court ordered a No Violent Contact Order. Case remains set for Pretrial Conference in branch 40 on 8/4/2015 at 1:30 PM.
Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.
Case set for Branch 40 in Branch 23 for a hearing on the no contact order. Case set for 7/28/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. Parties advised.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.D.S. dob 3-4-1974.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stacy E Lukasavitz in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-23-2015 at 01:30pm
